author: Russell Breiter
id: Russell Breiter_I had 340 days last year. Relapsed on December 16th. I have not stopped and never have struggled like th
text: I had 340 days last year. Relapsed on December 16th. I have not stopped and never have struggled like this before. I’m worried the abuse I’ve done to my body the last two months is not fixable. I’m so scared and can’t take it anymore.

author: Karunamitra Griffith
id: Karunamitra Griffith_Here’s something that happened that’s interesting. I host trivia in restaurants and they have a bar
text:
Here’s something that happened that’s interesting. I host trivia in restaurants and they have a bar area. I asked the question how many steps are there in Alcoholics Anonymous’s program of recovery. Everyone got the answer right. 15 teams.
After the question, a woman came up to me and said you know that’s inappropriate to ask something like that in a bar I ￼ asked why. She said people might be struggling with alcohol issues. I said then maybe the question will motivate them and I laughed. She didn’t laugh. Wow. The thought that just hearing about AA which trigger such a response is a crazy thing many times we do ask questions about addictions, but I never got a response like this.

author: Anonymous participant
id: Anonymous participant_Last night I went to my 2nd in-person AA meeting. I felt so out of place. Everyone was talking abo
text:
Last night I went to my 2nd in-person AA meeting. I felt so out of place. Everyone was talking about hitting rock bottom over and over and I have no dramatic rock-bottom stories.
I was a high-functioning alcoholic for 20 years, then only in the last 6 months (in between jobs) I spiraled to the point where I was losing days, but still never did anything REALLY bad worth talking about.
I'd like to tell my story, but I feel like … See more
